text: but the second big paradigm shift is
also the changes to compute so back in
the day we all started with physical
machines and maintaining servers but
when the cloud came around we moved to
virtualized machines I mean I still had
people asking me why would I trust a
bookseller with my infrastructure as
late as just six years ago and for the
folks that couldn't quite used to
virtualization we used to joke although
those the server huggers because they
really need to see the blinking lights
but then as we moved on we developed
containerization in isolation so that we
could deploy code much much faster but
at the end of the day we were still
maintaining servers so we thought what
if we could even take that off of our
two pizza teams and we developed in
service technologies for compute such as
lambda and bar gate and this was really
the missing link the rest of the stack
had already gone service whether it was
the notification systems or the database
and so the the last piece was to get to
service compute
you
